meanings.definition: To lease or rent (a property) to a subtenant.
meanings.sent1: She is subleasing her apartment to a friend while she travels.
meanings.sent2: They are subleasing the office space to a small startup company.
meanings.sent3: The idea of subleasing the garage to squirrels for acorn storage made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Subleasing the old factory to creativity turned the space into a vibrant art studio.
meanings.sent5: Subleasing can help you earn extra money from your unused property.

meanings.definition: The act of subleasing a property.
meanings.sent1: The subleasing of the house was a smooth process.
meanings.sent2: He decided to engage in subleasing to cover his rent expenses.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a skit about the chaos of subleasing a haunted mansion.
meanings.sent4: The concept of subleasing was like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into the real estate market.
meanings.sent5: Subleasing can be a convenient solution for temporary space needs.
